page.title:
OMI Near UV Aerosol Products (388 nm)
OMI Near UV Aerosol Products (388 nm)
page.normal_text:
Aerosol Index (AI) Qualitative Indicator of the presence of absorbing aerosols: smoke, desert dust, volcanic ash. It is calculated using observations at two wavelengths in the range 330-390 nm.
Aerosol Index (AI)
Qualitative Indicator of the presence of absorbing aerosols:
smoke, desert dust, volcanic ash. It is calculated using observations at two
wavelengths in the range 330-390 nm.

Extinction Optical Depth, AOD A measure of the aerosol capacity to extinguish radiation by scattering and absorption. It is related to the total column amount of aerosol particles in the atmosphere.
Extinction Optical Depth, AOD
A measure of the aerosol capacity to extinguish radiation by scattering and
absorption. It is related to the total column amount of aerosol particles in the
atmosphere.

Single Scattering Albedo, SSA A measure of the fractional extinction due to scattering of incident solar radiation. Varies between 0 (all absorption, no scattering) and 1 (all scattering, no absorption). Typical variability range (0.6 to 1.0)
Single Scattering Albedo, SSA
A measure of the fractional extinction due to scattering of incident solar
radiation.
Varies between 0 (all absorption, no scattering) and 1 (all scattering, no
absorption). Typical variability range (0.6 to 1.0)

Absorption Optical Depth, AAOD The actual optical depth resulting from the absorption process. It is easily calculated as
Absorption Optical Depth, AAOD
The actual optical depth resulting from the absorption process. It is easily
calculated as

AAOD = AODx(1.0 – SSA)
AAOD = AODx(1.0 – SSA) A A O D
=
A O D x ( 1 . 0
– S S A )
page.footer:
Courtesy of OMAR Torres
Courtesy of OMAR Torres

page.title:
OMI UV Aerosol Index
OMI UV Aerosol Index
page.normal_text:
Aerosol Index = 100 x log Measured Radiance (354 nm)
Aerosol Index = 100 x log Measured Radiance (354 nm)

Calc. Rayleigh Radiance (354 nm)
Calc. Rayleigh Radiance (354 nm)

Positive values for UV-absorbing particles: desert dust, smoke, volcanic ash
Positive values for UV-absorbing particles: desert dust, smoke, P o s i t i v e
v a l u e s
f o r
U V - a b s o r b i n g
p a r t i c l e s :
d e s e r t
d u s t ,
s m o k e ,
volcanic ash

Negative values for small size (less than 0.2 microns) non-absorbing particles. In practice, it is difficult to separate aerosol effects from other non-aerosol effects that also produce negative AI values. Aerosol Index yields near-zero values for clouds.
Negative values for small size (less than 0.2 microns) non-absorbing
particles. In practice, it is difficult to separate aerosol effects from p a r t i c l e s .

other non-aerosol effects that also produce negative AI values.
Aerosol Index yields near-zero values for clouds.

Magnitude of positive AI depends mainly on aerosol absorption optical depth and height of aerosol layer. Also depends on aerosol microphysical properties.
Magnitude of positive AI depends mainly on aerosol absorption
optical depth and height of aerosol layer. Also depends on aerosol
microphysical properties.

page.title:
Properties of the OMI UV Aerosol Index
Properties of the OMI UV Aerosol Index
page.normal_text:
Detects absorbing aerosols over all surface types: ocean, vegetated surfaces, deserts, snow/ice, etc
Detects absorbing aerosols over all surface types: ocean, vegetated D e t e c t s
a b s o r b i n g
a e r o s o l s
o v e r
a l l
s u r f a c e
t y p e s :
o c e a n ,
v e g e t a t e d
surfaces, deserts, snow/ice, etc

Detects absorbing aerosols under partial cloudiness conditions and above clouds
Detects absorbing aerosols under partial cloudiness conditions and
above clouds

Aerosol Index is insensitive to carbonaceous aerosols (smoke) below ~ 2km
Aerosol Index is insensitive to carbonaceous aerosols (smoke) below ~
2km

Larger sensitivity to low altitude desert aerosols (~ 0.5 km)
Larger sensitivity to low altitude desert aerosols (~ 0.5 km)

Aerosol Index signal meaningful for values larger than 0.5
Aerosol Index signal meaningful for values larger than 0.5 A e r o s o l

picture.caption: Courtesy of OMAR Torres Transport around the globe of a high altitude smoke layer generated by the Australian fires in December 2006. Numbers indicate the day of the month.

-Validation tool for transport models -Separation of carbonaceous from sulfate aerosols -Identification of aerosols above PBL the (i.e., PBL aerosols are not detectable by AI) -Tracking of aerosol plumes above clouds and over ice/snow -Detection of UTLS (upper troposphere/lower stratosphere) aerosols -Validation tool for transport models

ice/snow

Advantages of near UV retrieved products (AOD/SSA)
Advantages of near UV retrieved products (AOD/SSA)
page.footer:
Courtesy of OMAR Torres
Courtesy of OMAR Torres
page.enlisting:
-Retrieval capability over deserts where traditional visible and near IR methods fail. -Retrieval capability of aerosol single scattering albedo. -Sensitivity to aerosol layer height -Sub-pixel cloud contamination associated with large footprint (instrument limitation) -Works best under conditions of minimum cloud contamination and large scale aerosol events (desert dust and smoke plumes) -Small horizontal scale events (non-absorbing aerosols) are difficult to detect because of sub-pixel cloud contamination. -Retrieval capability over deserts where traditional visible and near IR methods fail.
-Retrieval capability over deserts where traditional visible and near IR
methods fail.
-Retrieval capability of aerosol single scattering albedo.
-Retrieval capability of aerosol single scattering albedo.
-Sensitivity to aerosol layer height
-Sensitivity to aerosol layer height - S e n s i t i v i t y
t o
a e r o s o l
l a y e r
h e i g h t
-Sub-pixel cloud contamination associated with large footprint (instrument limitation)
-Sub-pixel cloud contamination associated with large footprint
(instrument limitation)
-Works best under conditions of minimum cloud contamination and large scale aerosol events (desert dust and smoke plumes)
-Works best under conditions of minimum cloud contamination and
large scale aerosol events (desert dust and smoke plumes)
-Small horizontal scale events (non-absorbing aerosols) are difficult to detect because of sub-pixel cloud contamination.
-Small horizontal scale events (non-absorbing aerosols) are difficult to
detect because of sub-pixel cloud contamination.
